title: Training a young TEXAS COWBODY to ride fences and fix BARB WIRE

tasks.task: Repairing and maintaining fence posts and electric wire
subtasks: Starting the UTV and driving on the farm
Identifying broken wires and insulators along the fence
Cutting and removing damaged wires and yellow insulators
Braiding new wire into broken strands without additional tools
Tightening fence wires by pulling tension and crimping with hand tools
Driving staples and reinforcing fence posts with hand hammers
Teaching a young helper (Gatlin) the necessary skills for fence repair
Demonstrating proper fencing techniques and maintaining thoroughness

tasks.task: Performing three-point turns on the UTV
subtasks: Observing correctly to ensure a safe three-point turn
Navigating the UTV through designated driveways and areas

tasks.task: Cleaning up debris from the fence area
subtasks: Removing visible debris and tangled wires to prevent animal hazards

tasks.task: Subtasks MAINTASK and MC per transcript instruction. Each main task represents a distinct physical task related to the given video transcript. Subtasks break down the main tasks into specific actions performed by the individuals on the farm. Additional tasks were added for relevant activities not explicitly mentioned as main tasks but required for the job.
